Feature.name: Sort, Filter, Group
Feature.Description: C1CollectionView implements the ICollectionView interface and provides live Sorting, Filtering and Grouping, the features absent in the native CollectionViewSource/ICollectionView implementation, for any list control.

Feature.name: Set up grouping
Feature.Description: This sample shows how to setup ListBox and GridView controls to work with C1CollectionView in the group mode.

Feature.name: FlexGrid
Feature.Description: Shows C1CollectionView support built into C1FlexGrid. Tap a column header once or twice to sort that column.

Feature.name: See it in Action
Feature.Description: FlexGrid® is a fast, full-featured grid control that combines the powerful built-in features you want with the flexibility and extensibility you need. Get sorting, grouping, cell formatting, cell merging, aggregates and more.

SubFeature.name: Grouping Filtering
SubFeature.Description: FlexGrid supports live sorting, filtering and grouping through C1CollectionView. Some of these features are absent in the native CollectionViewSource/ICollectionView implementation. Group aggregates are also supported so you can display sums and counts in grouped rows. Tap a column header once or twice to sort that column.

SubFeature.name: Full Text Filter
SubFeature.Description: This demo shows how to filters and highlights the data across all columns.

Feature.name: Editing
Feature.Description: The C1FlexGrid supports Excel-style editing. Just type values into cells and use the enter or arrow keys to move to the next one. Or press F2 and enter full-edit mode, where arrow keys navigate within the editor. Auto-complete and value-mapped columns are also built-in: simply create a ColumnValueConverter and assign it to the columns ValueConverter property and you're done. Transactioned edits are supported too. The Customer class used here implements IEditableObject, so you can undo changes by pressing the Escape key before you move to a new row. (Note: the gray columns are read-only). Note this feature is only supported by mouse and keyboard.

Feature.name: Live Updates
Feature.Description: Create custom cell content and show live updates. This demo shows a stock oriented example of simulated live data. Drag the freezing line to change the number of frozen columns or rows.

Feature.name: Media Library
Feature.Description: This demo showcases the C1FlexGrid's CellFactory interface used for customizing cells. We use custom cells to display images next to the artists, albums, songs, collapse/expand icons, and ratings. We can easily create custom cells by inheriting the ICellFactory interface and providing the FrameworkElement objects used to represent the cells.

Feature.name: Multi-Headers
Feature.Description: In addition to working with IEnumerable data sources, the C1FlexGrid also supports an unbound mode, where cell values are stored in the grid itself and are accessed using familiar indexing notation. This demo also shows how you can set up merged multi-cell row and column headers.

Feature.name: Excel-style
Feature.Description: This demo shows that you can perform Excel-style cell merging and cell splitting. Select a range of cells to merge or split.

Feature.name: Printing
Feature.Description: The C1FlexGrid supports printing through GetPageImages method, making it easy for users to configure PrintManager.

Feature.name: Sparkline
Feature.Description: Use the C1SparkLine control as a cell template in the C1FlexGrid control for the full datagrid experience.

Feature.name: Mouse Hover
Feature.Description: Mouse Hover Demonstration.

Feature.name: See it in Action
Feature.Description: The C1ListBox control is a high performance list box with horizontal orientation support, disabled selection and preview data templating.

SubFeature.name: HeikinAshi
SubFeature.Description: Heikin-Ashi charts are a variation of Japanese candlestick charts that were designed to remove noise from candlesticks and behave much like a moving average.

SubFeature.name: Line Break
SubFeature.Description: A Line Break or Three Line Break chart uses vertical boxes or lines to illustrate the price changes of an asset or market.

SubFeature.name: Renko
SubFeature.Description: The Renko chart uses bricks of uniform size to chart the price movement.

SubFeature.name: Kagi
SubFeature.Description: A Kagi chart displays supply and demand trends using a sequence of linked vertical lines.

SubFeature.name: ColumnVolume
SubFeature.Description: ColumnVolume charts are similar to Column charts, except that they accept a second value, volume, which dictates the width of each bar.

SubFeature.name: EquiVolume
SubFeature.Description: EquiVolume charts are similar to Candlestick charts, but they only show the high and low values.

SubFeature.name: CandleVolume
SubFeature.Description: CandleVolume charts are identical to standard Candlestick charts, except that the width of each bar is determined by a fifth value, volume.

SubFeature.name: Arms CandleVolume
SubFeature.Description: Created by Richard Arms, Arms CandleVolume charts are a combination of EquiVolume and CandleVolume charts.

SubFeature.name: Markers
SubFeature.Description: Markers display a text area on the FinancialChart that displays the data values based on the mouse cursor's position on the chart. Markers also support optional vertical and horizontal lines to enable a cross-hair effect.

SubFeature.name: Range Selector
SubFeature.Description: The example below demonstrates the typical use case for the RangeSelector and how to apply a custom style.

SubFeature.name: Trend Lines
SubFeature.Description: Trend lines are used to visualize trends in data and to help analyze the problems of prediction.

SubFeature.name: Moving Average
SubFeature.Description: Moving average trend lines are used to analyze data by creating a series of averages of the original data set.

SubFeature.name: Overlays
SubFeature.Description: Overlays, like technical indicators, are a set of derived data that is calculated by applying one or more formulas to the original set of data. Overlays are generally used to forecast an asset's market direction and generally plotted with the original data set since the the Y-axis scales are the same.

SubFeature.name: Indicators
SubFeature.Description: A technical indicator is a set of derived data that is calculated by applying one or more formulas to the original set of data.

SubFeature.name: Event Annotations
SubFeature.Description: Event annotations are used to mark important events that can be attached to a specific data point on the FinancialChart. Hovering over the event annotation will reveal the full details of the event.

SubFeature.name: Fibonacci Tool
SubFeature.Description: Fibonacci tool is used for trend analysis in financial charts. With the help of range selector, you can choose data range for calculation.

SubFeature.name: Introduction
SubFeature.Description: This view shows the FlexChart's basic features. It binds the chart to a data source and allows you to select the chart type, series stacking, and rotation.

SubFeature.name: Animation
SubFeature.Description: FlexChart comes with advanced animation options for loading, updating, and adding new data.

SubFeature.name: Custom animation
SubFeature.Description: This view shows how to customize chart animation with AnimationTransform event.

SubFeature.name: Binding
SubFeature.Description: This view shows how you can use the FlexChart to show two sets of values from a single array of data. This is the most common usage scenario for the FlexChart.

SubFeature.name: Series Binding
SubFeature.Description: This view shows how you can use the FlexChart to show data from multiple data sources, one per series.

SubFeature.name: Header & Footer

SubFeature.name: Labels

SubFeature.name: HitTest
SubFeature.Description: This view demonstrates the use of the FlexChart's hitTest method. The hitTest method takes a point and returns the nearest chart element.
